results.title: Birds - how we identify them
results.brief_description: Accompanies two boys looking for birds. With field glasses and bird guide book, they see and identify many different birds. Demonstrates how to distinguish one bird from another, by their appearance, by the sounds they make, and their actions, both on the ground and in the air. The identifying characteristics of many more birds are pointed out as they are observed in their natural habitat. No other credits available.

results.title: Birdman of paradise; William T. Cooper: portrait painter to the birds
results.creator_credit: Paul Reddish, Robert Campbell, BBC, National Geographic Society and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: John Young is an expert on Australia’s Birds of Paradise. These rare birds are difficult to track and we follow John’s endeavours to record the mating rituals and displays of these birds. Bird artist William Cooper’s illustrations are considered the finest in this genre of painting. Sir David Attenborough narrates this program on a truly great artist.
results.title_for_label: Birdman of paradise; William T. Cooper: portrait painter to the birds

results.title: Birdman of Alcatraz
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Guy Trosper, Stuart Millar and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Robert Stroud was sentenced to serve 40 years in solitary confinement in Alcatraz. Nevertheless, he became one of the foremost authorities on birds and their diseases. His fascination and love for birds began when he nursed a sick and injured sparrow back to health. Encouraged in prison by a guard, Stroud developed his interest in birds which was strangely at odds with the harshness of the prison environment. Burt Lancaster gives an excellent performance as Stroud, Karl Malden plays the Warden, Telly Savalas is Stroud’s prison mate, Neville Brand is the prison guard and Thelma Ritter is outstanding as Stroud’s domineering mother.

results.title: Birdlovers of New South Wales: the story of the Gould League
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of the foundation and growth of the Gould League of Birdlovers, who study, watch and protect native birds. Photography by Harry Malcolm with majority of bird shots by Norman Chaffer. Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Bird Watcher's Hide
results.brief_description: A young boy is introduced to bird watching by an experienced watcher. On the Scottish moors he learns how to select a bird, find the nest, construct the hide and patiently move it closer without disturbing the bird, until he is able to view intimately the bird’s habits. No other credits available.

results.title: Bird sanctuary
results.brief_description: The hatching and rearing of young seabirds in the Farne Islands off the coast of Britain. Such well-known birds as the kittiwakes, the guillemots, the cormorants, the puffins, the terns, the elderducks and the lesser known black-backed gulls are observed.

results.title: Bird safari in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jenny Erdos, Laszlo Erdos and David Cook
results.brief_description: Filmed entirely on location in the Mallee type country of Southern Australia, this film explores the paradise that is shared by birds, plants and insects in their natural environment. Features wonderful close-ups of undisturbed wildlife while the background music is a beautiful symphony of bird songs and calls. Narrated by Fred Parslow.

results.title: Bird of the thunder woman
results.creator_credit: David Parer and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: An analysis of a wealth exchange cycle in the Papua New Guinea Highlands. Shows part of the Sa cycle of the Wola people of Halalinja, Southern Highlands Province. Cassowaries and pigs, which are highly prized, are raised by the women. At a ceremony lasting two days the birds and pigs are slaughtered by the men and the meat is distributed to relatives and friends. This ceremony is just one in an elaborate cycle of gift exchanges. English commentary, Papua New Guinea dialogue with English subtitles. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: Bird banding in Australia
results.creator_credit: S.T. Evans, Division of Wildlife Research and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Shows how the handling of birds helps biologists to collect information essential for the study and conservation of rare species and the control of pests. Some of the diverse methods banders use for trapping wild birds are shown.

results.title: Birchip School: growing up in the Mallee
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, David Meagher, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Students talk about what it is like to grow up in a small rural town, discuss the pros and cons, and the impact that issues like the drought have had on their own lives.
